New Records: Travis Head smashed his 50 off just 19 balls to set a new Australian record against England in T20 internationals
17 balls — Marcus Stoinis v Sri Lanka 2022
18 balls — Glenn Maxwell v Sri Lanka 2016
18 balls — David Warner v West Indies 2010
19 balls — Cameron Green v South Africa 2022
19 balls — David Warner v South Africa 2009
Key Match Events: Travis Head smashed his 50 off just 19 balls
Adam Zampa then took 2-20 as Australia's bowlers got England all out 29 runs short of victory
Tim David made an outstanding running catch off Bartlett at deep mid-on to get rid of Cox
Post-Match Reflections: Mitch Marsh said, 'It's pretty exciting watching Heady go about his work, and Shorty. I thought they both started amazingly. Heady's a special talent'
Marsh added, 'We were certainly on par for above 200. We tried our best to stuff it up, but it's very nice to start the series with a win'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mitchell Marsh celebrated a wicket as Australia saw off England in their first T20 clash of the series in Southampton
England's chase flopped to 151 all out, dismantled by their key strike duo of Hazlewood and Zampa
